document.masterDocTitle: The freshwater shrimp family Euryrhynchidae Holthuis, 1950 (Crustacea: Decapoda: Caridea) revisited, with a taxonomic revision of the genus Euryrhynchus Miers, 1878

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The freshwater shrimp family Euryrhynchidae Holthuis, 1950 (Crustacea: Decapoda: Caridea) revisited, with a taxonomic revision of the genus Euryrhynchus Miers, 1878

bibRefCitation.author: Powell, C. B.
bibRefCitation.refString: Powell, C. B. (1976) Two new freshwater shrimps from West Africa: the first euryrhynchinids (Decapoda Palaemonidae) reported from the Old World. Revue de Zoologie Africaine, 90, 883 - 902.
bibRefCitation.title: Two new freshwater shrimps from West Africa: the first euryrhynchinids (Decapoda Palaemonidae) reported from the Old World

subSubSection.paragraph:
Euryrhynchyna edingtonae
— Pereira 1997 : 51, tab. 6 [ lap. cal. ].
Euryrhynchyna edingtone — Olomukoro 2009 : 309; Olomukoro & Dirisu 2014 : tab. 1 [ lap. cal. ].

Material examined.
Paratypes
:
11♂ (cl 3.4– 1.9 mm ), 23♀ (cl 3.2– 1.7 mm ), 4♀ ov (cl 3.2– 2.9 mm ), RMCA 54030 , Nigeria , Edo State, swamp forest along Ogba River , 06°12'N 05°35'E , coll. C.B. Powell ,
09.iv.1975
.
Additional material :
24♂ (cl 3.5– 1.9 mm ), 22♀ (cl 4.1– 2.2 mm ), 5♀ ov (cl 4.1– 3.2 mm ), USNM 171376 , Nigeria , Rivers State, Port Harcout , Rumokoroshe , swamp forest stream, 04°51'00''N 07°03'42''E , coll. F. Ojarikre & C.B. Powell ,
29.xii.1978
.

Type locality.
Swamp forest near Ogba River , about 8 km southwest of Benin city
,
Edo State ( Nigeria )
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 3. A–H,
Euryrhynchina edingtonae Powell, 1976
: male (cl 3.0 mm), Rumokoroshe, Rivers, Nigeria (USNM 171376). (A) Anterior region of the body, dorsal view; (B) Fourth sternite of pereon, median region, ventral view; (C) Fifth sternite of pereon, median region, ventral view; (D) Right second pereopod, lateral view; (E) Same, chela and carpus, dorsal (mesial) view; (F) Same, carpus and distal region of merus, mesial view, setae and granules omitted; (G) Left second pereopod, lateral view; (H) Same, chela and carpus, dorsal (mesial) view.

FIGURE 4. A–G,
Euryrhynchina edingtonae Powell, 1976
: male (cl 3.0 mm), Rumokoroshe, Rivers, Nigeria (USNM 171376). (A) Right third pereopod, lateral view; (B) Same, dactylus and distal region of propodus, lateral view; (C) Right fourth pereopod, lateral view; (D) Same, dactylus and distal region of propodus, lateral view; (E) Same, mesial view; (F) Right fifth pereopod, lateral view; (G) Same, dactylus and distal region of propodus, lateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Powell (1976: 895, figs. 5–7) . The material from Rumokoroshe ( Rivers State, Nigeria ) is illustrated in Figs. 3–4 .

Remarks. The material from Rivers State ( USNM 171376), studied by Pereira (1997) , represents the first record of
E. edingtonae
outside of Edo and Delta states where the species has been often reported ( Fig. 62B , yellow circles). The specimens match well the description and illustrations in Powell (1976) (see also Figs. 3 , 4 ). The genus
Euryrhynchina
was believed to be monotypic until recently when a second species was described (
De Grave et al . 2017
). For the morphological differences between the two species, see remarks under
E. puteola
.
